User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20111003132907

Steps to reproduce:

Click a link in a mail message in Thunderbird (7.0.1 on gentoo linux on amd64) started with an alternate locale (either from a terminal in that locale, or by specifying the locale in the program starter: LANG="nl_BE.UTF8" /usr/local/bin/thunderbird %U)


Actual results:

nothing, except, when starting in a terminal, after clicking a link, I get the following message:
---
$ thunderbird

** (thunderbird-bin:980): WARNING **: Could not launch default application for URI: Uitvoeren van dochterproces ‘LANG=nl_BE.UTF8’ is mislukt (Bestand of map bestaat niet)
---
so I did a further LANG-setting tests, with strange results:
---
$ LANG="en_US.UTF8" /usr/local/bin/thunderbird

** (thunderbird-bin:7444): WARNING **: Could not launch default application for URI: Failed to execute child process "LANG=nl_BE.UTF8" (No such file or directory)
---



Expected results:

Firefox (default application for http(s)) opens a new tab with the corresponding web page
comments.author: mozillabugzilla@equaeghe.nospammail.net

comments.raw_text:
(In reply to Erik Quaeghebeur from comment #0)
Did you have a recent Thunderbird upgrade? If yes, then check the solution in bug 583696.

(In reply to Hashem Masoud from comment #1)
> (In reply to Erik Quaeghebeur from comment #0)
> Did you have a recent Thunderbird upgrade? If yes, then check the solution
> in bug 583696.

That does not apply. As reported, it is related to prefixing with the locale, as is apparent from the error message. I now work with an xlocale.sh script run before starting KDE and links work again (this is a workaround; I still think this is a bug). 

It should be easy for somebody else to verify whether starting thunderbird with a locale string prepended results in the same issue I encountered. So first this bug should be confirmed.
